data: This guide will help you get started with the documentation site.
data.development#Development:
Run the development server:
npm run dev
Open http://localhost:3000 to view the documentation.
data.building#Building:
Build the static site:
npm run build
This will generate a static version of the site in the out directory.
data.deployment#Deployment:
The site is automatically deployed to GitHub Pages when:
Changes are merged to the main branch
A workflow is manually triggered
PR previews are automatically created for each pull request.

/.title: Welcome to GitHub Pages Test Documentation

data: This is a sample documentation site built with Nextra and Next.js Pages Router.
data.features#Features:
Static Site Generation: Built with Next.js for optimal performance
Markdown Support: Write documentation in MDX format
GitHub Pages: Automatically deployed to GitHub Pages
PR Previews: Preview documentation changes in pull requests
data.getting-started#Getting Started:
To get started with this documentation:
Navigate through the sidebar
Read the documentation
Contribute by creating pull requests
data.about-nextra#About Nextra: Nextra is a simple, powerful and flexible site generation framework built on top of Next.js.

data: This section covers advanced topics for working with the documentation.
data.customization#Customization: You can customize the theme by editing theme.config.jsx.
data.adding-pages#Adding Pages:
To add a new page:
Create a new .mdx file in the pages directory
Add the page to _meta.json to configure its order and title
Write your content in Markdown format
data.components#Components:
Nextra supports React components within MDX: export const MyComponent = () =>
Hello World!
data.images-and-assets#Images and Assets: Place static assets in the public directory and reference them in your documentation.
